title: Doctor Who Animated: Evil of the Daleks and more
description:
A superb 19-minute collection of animated scenes from lost Doctor Who stories
from the 1960s, starring William Hartnell and Patrick Troughton as the first and
second Doctors.

   Evil of the Daleks, The Smugglers, The Massacre, Galaxy 4, The Wheel in Space,
 Marco Polo, The Tenth Planet and more are featured.

   As featured in The Guardian, SFX Magazine, and The Wired Blog.


   For more information and to watch the animations, visit ocpmovie on Youtube.

  Read our beginner's guide at:
orangecow.org/who-sprites2/1guide


   This is in PAL DVD format.


   A remarkable program from animator Garrett Gilchrist of Orange Cow Productions,
this is the WhoSprites project, a unique style of animation blending almost
photorealistic likenesses of the actors with the loose drawn style of traditional
pen and ink animation.

  Unseen since their original broadcasts in the 1960s, there are 108 missing
episodes of Doctor Who, including some of the greatest stories the series ever
created. Now with this unique style of animation, the WhoSprites project is
attempting to bring these lost classics back to life for a new generation.

   This is a not for profit project. Garrett was hoping to get hired by the
official Doctor Who restoration team with this pilot project, but it didn't
happen. This was screened at a free-admission charity event put on by the
Kaleidoscope organization, on December 6th, 2008 - a different kind of Doctor
Who Christmas special, if you will.

   Garrett Gilchrist is the director of eight low budget feature films including
Shamelessly and Gods of Los Angeles. He's known as an animation scholar and
restorationist, who restored the lost animated classic The Thief and the Cobbler,
and has been a guest animation speaker at Santa Monica City College and ASIFA
San Francisco. He lives in Southern California.

   His company, Orange Cow Productions, is available for hire for all your
animation, film and graphic design needs.

  Visit orangecow.org.
